entry.title: Compose: Debounce updating scrollable classes
entry.content:
A ResizeObserver observes any changes in height on the scrollable body

so that it can draw lines above/below it when it becomes scrollable.

This debounces that check so that the check doesn't happen as often.

This is useful for when animations cause the size to change with every

frame, which sometimes resulted in extra lines being drawn while

the size was still changing.



Before: http://screencast/cast/NTY2NDUzMDczMzQ2NTYwMHwzNGFjZmY5OS1hOQ

After: http://screencast/cast/NjIxOTYyNTEwNzgxNjQ0OHxiNGMyYmFlMS1mYw

(In the Before video, there's a line below the body that flickers.)



Change-Id: I03c38e6bc95f407c8d250042c7ea64594d542648

entry.title: [libc++] Add the <__assertion_handler> header
entry.content:
Because of https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/77883, libc++

headers now #include an __assertion_handler header file that is

either generated by CMake or provided by the vendor. Since we don't use

CMake for libc++, this CL vendors <__assertion_handler> by copying the

file default_assertion_handler.in [0], which is the file that CMake uses

to generate the default version of <__assertion_handler>.



This CL is needed to unblock the libc++ autoroller (since otherwise

libc++ won't compile due to the missing header).



[0]: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/main/libcxx/vendor/llvm/default_assertion_handler.in



Bug: 1517992

Change-Id: Ia551bdb706f7e68db914ddf46bf2128cdb1a6284

Fixed: 1517992

entry.title: [gpu] Remove some of unused texture_manager.h includes
entry.content:
Remove few texture_manager.h and other includes as identified in [1]

which analyzes include graph and identifies top includes and their

added sizes. When filtered on shared_image/ directory texture_manager.h

contributes quite a bit of size. This change removes it from some

files where it isn't really necessary.



Running compiler_inputs_size.py on before/after this change we get:

Before: 377,748,735,464 bytes

After: 377,710,848,487 bytes

thus reducing binary size by approx ~38MB



[1] https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/chromium-browser-clang/include-analysis.html#view=edges

entry.title: SimpleCache: fix unwanted re-entry when size update...
entry.content:
...triggers entry doom and thus ends up running the operation queue in the wrong spot of creation (and entry op) completion handler. This can among other things result in this madness:



#6 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::CloseInternal()

#7 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#8 SimpleEntryImpl::ScopedOperationRunner::~ScopedOperationRunner()

#9 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::WriteDataInternal()

#10 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#11 SimpleEntryImpl::ScopedOperationRunner::~ScopedOperationRunner()

#12 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::WriteDataInternal()

#13 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#14 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::DoomEntry()

#15 disk_cache::SimpleBackendImpl::DoomEntryFromHash()

#16 disk_cache::SimpleBackendImpl::DoomEntries()

#17 disk_cache::SimpleIndex::StartEvictionIfNeeded()

#18 disk_cache::SimpleIndex::UpdateEntrySize()

#19 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::UpdateDataFromEntryStat()

#20 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::CreationOperationComplete()

(namespace elided twice to avoid wrapping).



... which means we end up at the in_results = nullptr line near the bottom of CreationOperationComplete with null `synchronous_entry_`(!) (and a dangling in_results->sync_entry, where one would expect the two to be aliases). I *think* we won't actually deliver a callback from this state since we likely needed to be in optimistic path to got thus far, but I am not certain.



Similarly, when this sort of thing happens from within read/write ops, it could potentially cause callbacks to be delivered in wrong order if the queued op ends up being a stream 0 operation, which can be executed without a round trip to a worker thread.



Change-Id: Iac8058f0d18225677e361c6cdddf92d28fb4833f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5054619

Reviewed-by: Adam Rice

Reviewed-by: Kenichi Ishibashi

Commit-Queue: Maks Orlovich

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248862}

asserts are not valid. This is because if the Hub animation is

cancelled the associated runnable no longer needs to run and can be

is cancelled we don't need to null out the runnables to avoid object

leaks.

entry.title: Parse privilege Group when config is read
entry.content:
A gnrt_config.toml may specify a 3p package's privilege group, in

accordance with our 3p security policies. This had been read into a

string field in CrateConfig, then parsed later.



The group field is changed to have type Option using new serde

impls for Group. ToString and the new_from_str methods were only used

for de/serialization, and serde handles this for enums itself so they

are removed.

entry.title: Add correctness tests for VideoFrameConverter.
entry.content:
This creates four color YUV and RGB frames, applies conversion,

and compares the resulting frames against the ideal version.



I considered just using white/black per the suggestion on the

previous change, but you could end up with passing values with

only the Y plane converted correctly.



For now I've just put the four color creation code inside the

test file, but it's likely other tests could benefit from

these functions in the future.



An alternative implementation would have been to only create the

RGB version of four colors, then use ConvertAndScale to create

the expected version. However, this felt too dependent on the

code under test to me (though both still use libyuv).



Bug: 1116617, 1116564, 1378115

Change-Id: I9a6e3f673245caf9c1d5f9bf164e51228b07a6c5

entry.title: Fix testing state leak.
entry.content:
ChromeShelfPrefs testing state is leaking to other tests,

and they're causing following tests to fails.

E.g.:

- ChromeShelfControllerLacrosOnlyTest.WithoutAppService

- ChromeShelfControllerWithArcTest.ArcAppsHiddenFromLaunchCanBePinned

- ChromeShelfControllerWithArcTest.ArcAppPinCrossPlatformWorkflow

in this order causes the second test to fail, and the third test to crash.

entry.title: gif_recording: Account for the time needed to finalize recorded file
entry.content:
GIF may take a while to finalize the encoding and file saving after

the stop recording button is pressed and recording ends. Starting

a new recording in this transient state should not be allowed. The

file must be allowed to finalize first.



This CL adds `can_start_new_recording()` which must be checked to

see if it's possible to allow starting video recordings.

entry.title: wm: fix the wrong reverse scrolling gestures
entry.content:
This cl fixed the wrong reverse scrolling gestures of entering and

exiting Overview and switching to next and previous desks. In

addition, we cleaned up the toasts of wrong gesture warnings.



When touchpad reverse scrolling is ON, we expect to enter Overview

by swiping up with 3 fingers and exit Overview by swiping down with

3 fingers (same with the gestures when the reverse scrolling is OFF).

We expect to switch to next desk by swiping left with 4 fingers and

switch to previous desk by swiping right with 4 fingers (opposite to

the gestures when the reverse scrolling is OFF). However, the

directions of all these gestures are wrong. This is because we used

to check if the touchpad reverse scrolling is enabled by checking

active user's preference. However, the settings is changed to

per-device such that we can only get it from the

InputDeviceSettingsController with a certain device ID.



In this cl, we first overloaded the function

window_util::IsNaturalScrollOn by adding a device ID parameter which

is used to check the reverse scrolling setting from

InputDeviceSettingsController. We then used it in the WmGestureHandler

for entering and exiting Overview and switching desks gestures. We

also made the corresponding unit tests to get reverse scrolling

settings from a mock input device settings controller. We fixed the

issues of the continuous Overview animation tests which forgot to

flip the vertical offset when the reverse scrolling is ON.



Bug: b:319331387

entry.title: Rename QuicStreamFactory to QuicSessionPool.
entry.content:
This class used to create QUIC streams, but now creates and pools QUIC

sessions instead. This rename brings it in line with SpdySessionPool and

its `RequestSession` method.



This CL has no functional impact. It is a mechanistic rename, performed

with `sed`. It avoids renaming existing metrics, preferring continuity

of data over accuracy of the name.



```

sed -i 's/quic_stream_factory/quic_session_pool/g;s/QUIC_STREAM_FACTORY/QUIC_SESSION_POOL/g;s/QuicStreamFactory/QuicSessionPool/g' $(git grep -il 'quic.\?stream.\?factory')

sed -i 's/quic_stream_request/quic_session_request/g;s/QUIC_STREAM_REQUEST/QUIC_SESSION_REQUEST/g;s/QuicStreamRequest/QuicSessionRequest/g' $(git grep -il 'quic.\?stream.\?request')

for f in net/quic/*quic_stream_factory*; do n=$(echo $f | sed -e s/stream/session/g); git mv $f $n; done

sed -i 's/Net\.QuicSessionPool/Net.QuicStreamFactory/g' $(git grep -il 'Net.QuicSession' net/ tools/)

git cl format

```



Change-Id: I20ceb3d8a0a97cd9c8888bb7414b983b9fe5fa51

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190439

entry.title: [RTCPeerConnection] Exit early from RTCPeerConnectionHandler
entry.content:
For certain operations that require a live client

(i.e., RTCPeerConnection, which is garbage collected),

PeerConnectionHandler keeps a pointer to the client on the stack

to prevent garbage collection.



In some cases, the client may have already been garbage collected

(the client is null). In that case, there is no point in doing the

operation and it should exit early to avoid UAF/crashes.



This CL adds early exit to the cases that do not already have it.



Bug: 1514777

entry.title: Make ink drop ripples respect opacity after being recreated active.
entry.content:
InkDropRipple::SnapToState does not account for opacity meaning when an

ink drop is recreated due to something like bounds changes it will have

the incorrect opacity (appearing too light) if it is supposed to be in

an active state or any other state that would typically have a darker

highlight. InkDropRipple subclasses handle the opacity themselves

through virtual methods for animating state changes and SnapToActive

which is why this is typically not an issue.



This cl makes SnapToState being called with ACTIVATED respond the same

way as it does for HIDDEN by calling a virtual method

SetStateToActivated that is overridden by by subclasses to handle

visibility, opacity, and transforms.



This fixes a few bugs exposed with the side panel pinning feature, the

easiest to recreate is when pinning/unpinning a side panel the toolbar

button would have the incorrect highlight opacity.



Bug: 1517012

Change-Id: I52fb79c4fd53743d06aa185ca6b41023798099eb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5207031

entry.title: Update overflow-scroll-animates test
entry.content:
This patch modernizes the test and addresses potential sources of

flakiness.



The initial scroll position was ill-defined. If the test loaded with

the container fully scrolled, it would fail. Added an explicit reset

of the scroll position.



Updated the test to use test-driver instead of EventSender. Though

not porting to WPT at this time, the update makes a future migration

of the test easier.



Updated to use a promise_test instead of TestRunner. Again this

makes a potential migration to WPT easier.



Switched from "end" to "pageDown" for the KeyEvent. The Home and End

keys have some platform-specific behavior (Mac). Also End is typically

associated with scrolling in the inline direction and not the block

direction. PageDown seems like a more natural choice. What is important

for the test is that we do not immediately jump to the new scroll

position but instead animate with multiple updates to the scroll

position.



Ran with --repeat-each=100 and no flakes.



Updating text expectations in a followup CL.



Bug: 1515102

Change-Id: Ie0669e30c70d907ecd284e87acec2da256ec8a77

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5189270

Reviewed-by: David Bokan

Commit-Queue: Kevin Ellis

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248815}

entry.title: AnchorElementMetricsSender: Lazily bind the metrics host remote
entry.content:
Some methods in this class, such as AddAnchorElement, bind the metrics

host remote even though they don't use it. This allows them to avoid

doing useless work if the messages will not be sent. However, binding

has a measurable performance cost on a hot path. We now only bind when

the remote is about to be used. The other callers now check for the

frame that would be used for binding without actually binding.



From local testing on my workstation, this saves about 3ms when loading

a page with about 600 anchors.



Bug: 1419556

Change-Id: I38599d69bf0288c54e7be76e4a09055dc43d25be

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5200662

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Add wasmURL/updateURLgenerateBid() WPT tests.
entry.content:
Make sure generateBid() gets biddingWasmHelperURL and updateURL. Since

the WASM tests require a valid WASM file to run generateBid(), also add

such a file, and add some no-winner WASM tests as well, where the WASM

file fails to load, for various reasons.



Also make sure that tests that use cross-origin iframes use UTF-8.

For some reason, the cross-origin iframe used by some sets were

being rendered with Windows-1252, which affects how unpair surrogates

are handled.



We still need tests that the WASM file is actually successfully parsed

as WASM and can be executed, but that's an issue for another day. The

WASM script the tests currently use is incrementer.wasm, which is

used by a bunch of other WPT tests. No tests currently actually call

into the WASM code, they just load it.



Bug: 1425952

Change-Id: I51e6037664491ac8bf6faceed0f6a53e13d8745c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5189267

entry.title: Don't request renderpass textures bigger than max texture size
entry.content:
Some Mali GPUs has GL_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE set to 16383 which is not a

multiple of 64. When calculating the renderpass texture size both

width and height are currently rounded up to a multiple of 64. So

when a renderpass is 16383 on these devices it gets rounded up to

16384 which is larger than the max texture size. Such a large

renderpass was requested when performing a view-transition on a

very large iframe in https://crbug.com/1516874



This patch clamps the rounded renderpass texture to the max texture

size.



Bug: 1516874

Change-Id: I0ff76e3431129be4add162be5ce37f0f4dab43e7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5183026

entry.title: [iOS] Add account picker confirmation screen child view controller
entry.content:
This CL adds a `accountConfirmationChildViewController` field to

`AccountPickerCoordinator` so that users may inject a view above the

identity button control in the account picker confirmation screen. This

will be used to present a choice between "Files" and "Drive" as a

destination for a downloaded file, as part of the Save to Drive feature.



When the "Files" option is selected, the identity button will be hidden

since there is no account to choose to save a file locally, and it will

be shown when "Drive" is selected instead. As a result, a method

- (void)setIdentityButtonHidden:(BOOL)hidden animated:(BOOL)animated;

is added to allow `AccountPickerCoordinator` users to show/hide the

identity button control in the confirmation screen.



Bug: 1495352

entry.title: Factor out SVG <paint> setup for text/decorations
entry.content:
This adds a new helper PrepareSvgPaints() that populates a SvgPaints

structure containing cc::PaintFlags for 'fill' and 'stroke'

respectively. This helper handles all current cases (clip-as-mask,

text-match, "normal" text).



The various TextPainter::PaintSvg* functions are updated to call this

helper. The paint-order handling becomes a switch that picks the right

field from the SvgPaints structure and then calls the lower-level

function.

entry.title: Fix returning fallback type for additional supported types
entry.content:
GetFallbackTypeForType takes a field_type object and searches for the

node that supports that type, and then returns GetFallbackType of that

node.



Previously, GetFallbackType used to return storage_type_ unconditionally

but this does not work for nodes that support types other than

storage_type_ (e.g. ADDRESS_HOME_LINE(1|2|3) and NAME_MIDDLE_INITIAL)



This CL fixes this by passing the supported field_type to the function

and returning it unconditionally instead of storage_type_.



Bug: b/311604770

Change-Id: I4fefed1e8c602348c2f82e584c68233c12c37162

entry.title: [IdleTimeout] Adding metrics on ios
entry.content:
This is the extension of crrev.com/c/5186320 for iOS.



The CL records the metrics for idle timeout actions and UI events as follows:



- Time taken to clear browsing data, time taken to sign out and the total time for all actions.

- The success of running of every action and all actions.

- Whether actions run on background or foreground.

- The dialog timeout dialog events (shown, dismissed by user and expired)

- The launch screen events (shown, dismissed on action completion and expired)

entry.title: Revert "Reland "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 848ff70c9e421ab12f4fcc444bd6c6178f7363df.



Reason for revert: This seems to break the android-binary-size-generator bot. See https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-binary-size-generator/86131/overview



Original change's description:

> Reland "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

>

> This reverts commit af43747f42b8e4cd92542c69abb06d66eecc03df.

>

> Reason for reland: Bot's updated with checkout_pgo_profiles=True

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

> >

> > This reverts commit 0f58e5ed22c50498c4122491520b0720b38c0150.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Breaking internal CQ. E.g.:

> > https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/try/android-internal-binary-size/26090/overview

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default

> > >

> > > The most popular arm64 builds (Trichrome) are shipping with

> > > is_high_end_android. The Monochrome arm64 builds are shipped for old

> > > devices, and we expect these to gradually become less popular.

> > >

> > > This change sets is_high_end_android to true for arm64 builds by

> > > default.

> > >

> > > This would make local benchmarking slightly less error prone because

> > > there would be a little less to remember to set in GN args when making a

> > > build for the most popular official configuration.

> > >

> > > Known effects:

> > >

> > > 1. Seemingly all official arm64 builders now explicitly set

> > > is_high_end_android. Hence no effect for them.

> > >

> > > 2. Non-official arm64 builders will change to become high-end, even the

> > > ones that end up running on old devices (example: android-arm64-rel).

> > > In this patch we make sure that is_high_end_android is ignored for

> > > non-official builds (disabled RELR relocations for non-official).

> > > Hence, no effect here as well.

> > >

> > > 3. Official builds of Monochrome made by devs would fail to run on

> > > Android pre-P (because RELR support is lacking). This leads to

> > > mysterious crashes during something-dlopen in the Android dynamic

> > > linker. Hopefully nobody does this before we remove support for

> > > Android O.

> > >

> > > Bug: 1515925

> > > Change-Id: I695c98852bb410894144452211aa06cc32ffb141

entry.title: Remove RunPerformanceManagerOnMainThread from field trial testing config
entry.content:
Until we're ready to experiment with the PM on the main thread again,

the config means browser tests don't match the code that runs in

production.



Also, since the config doesn't apply on the more obscure platforms in

the CQ, it can be hard to diagnose threading errors in browser tests

that are only hit on those platforms (eg. in

https://crrev.com/c/5198421/8 where a sequence check in TestFuture

was only hit on fuscia-x64-cast-receiver-rel).

entry.content:
Android calls __llvm_profile_dump() for their native tests, but Android

test devices haven't been configured to use the continuous mode yet.

This CL temporarily enables __llvm_profile_dump() for Android to fix

coverage until Android test devices have been configured to use the

continuous mode.



Android devices aren't affected by recipe changes, so this shouldn't

cause any issues with the upcoming recipe change

entry.title: Replace AutofillType::ToString by AutofillType::ToStringView.
entry.content:
AutofillType currently explicitly returns the string_view representation

obtained from a util function to a std::string. That is unnecessary,

since most callers only require a std::string_view and the few callers

that do need a std::string can convert it themselves.



This is in preparation for a CL that will compare AutofillTypes by

their string(_view) representation, for which we at least want to avoid

the temporary constructions of std::strings.



Change-Id: I4561e83e6b5f9a7cdd57afe01fe0d6d0048fbbbe

entry.title: Merge ParseFieldSpecificsWithNewPatterns and FieldMatchesMatchPatternRef
entry.content:
The two functions are almost an exact copy of each other. The difference

is that the former takes an AutofillScanner, while the latter takes just

an AutofillField.



This CL:

- Makes FieldMatchesMatchPatternRef() slightly more generic by adding an

optional projection parameter (like the existing parameter of

of ParseFieldSpecificsWithNewPatterns()).

- Implements ParseFieldSpecificsWithNewPatterns() in terms of

FieldMatchesMatchPatternRef(), by calling it with the current field of

the scanner and manually advancing it, in case of success.

- Inlines MatchAndAdvance() into ParseFieldSpecificsWithLegacyPattern(),

since this is the only remaining call site.



Bug: 1007974

entry.title: [SPC] Allow 'publickey-credentials-create' for SPC creation
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/ab904a46 added the ability to use the

'publickey-credentials-create' permissions policy for WebAuthn

credential creation in a cross-origin iframe. However, if the

credential was for SPC (i.e., has the "payment" extension

specified), it still required the 'payment' permission policy.



This CL changes it so that SPC credential creation can occur in a

cross-origin iframe that has *either* the 'payment' (for backwards

compatibility) or 'publickey-credentials-create' policy.



In order to have content/browser/webauth/webauth_browsertest.cc

cover SPC credential creation, we needed //content to have some

sort of PaymentCredential mojo service. As such, this CL also adds

a stub PaymentCredential service for //content (which is overridden

with the real version for //chrome). This has the side effect of

making a WPT test start passing (as it was only failing due to the

lack of a //content hook for the given mojo API).



The change is still behind the

WebAuthnAllowCreateInCrossOriginFrame flag.



Bug: 1512605

Change-Id: Icfd61c5c294e85a5c273b2ff8ccca13e1070dab6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5141746

Commit-Queue: Stephen McGruer

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248755}

> Revert "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

>

> This reverts commit 0f58e5ed22c50498c4122491520b0720b38c0150.

>

> Reason for revert: Breaking internal CQ. E.g.:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/try/android-internal-binary-size/26090/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default

> >

> > The most popular arm64 builds (Trichrome) are shipping with

> > is_high_end_android. The Monochrome arm64 builds are shipped for old

> > devices, and we expect these to gradually become less popular.

> >

> > This change sets is_high_end_android to true for arm64 builds by

> > default.

> >

> > This would make local benchmarking slightly less error prone because

> > there would be a little less to remember to set in GN args when making a

> > build for the most popular official configuration.

> >

> > Known effects:

> >

> > 1. Seemingly all official arm64 builders now explicitly set

> > is_high_end_android. Hence no effect for them.

> >

> > 2. Non-official arm64 builders will change to become high-end, even the

> > ones that end up running on old devices (example: android-arm64-rel).

> > In this patch we make sure that is_high_end_android is ignored for

> > non-official builds (disabled RELR relocations for non-official).

> > Hence, no effect here as well.

> >

> > 3. Official builds of Monochrome made by devs would fail to run on

> > Android pre-P (because RELR support is lacking). This leads to

> > mysterious crashes during something-dlopen in the Android dynamic

> > linker. Hopefully nobody does this before we remove support for

> > Android O.

> >

> > Bug: 1515925

> > Change-Id: I695c98852bb410894144452211aa06cc32ffb141

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169071

> > Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

> > Commit-Queue: Egor Pasko

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247286}

>

entry.title: Fix memory dumps for android media
entry.content:
SharedImages don't own memory directly, so we're trying to guess which

images own memory to decide what number to report. Eventually this lead

to result being in accurate. To avoid this, we will report memory that

is used by TextureOwners which actually owner buffers, and make SI to

report 0.

entry.title: Prerender: Grant mojom::PageLoadMetrics on WebView
entry.content:
Before this CL, on WebView, mojo binding requests for

page_load_metrics::mojom::PageLoadMetrics cancels prerendering for the

mojo capability control. This is not a preferable behavior.



To fix it, this CL grants the mojo interface on the mojo capability

control. The Chrome embedder has already done the same thing:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client_binder_policies.cc;l=40-41;drc=b2d5c987a659beff1f4a980d1af3754914a3a1f5



Unfortunately, we don't have automated test infra for prerendering on

WebView yet, so we confirmed this change by manual testing.



Bug: 1518100

entry.title: Separate ApplicationSettingsCommands from ApplicationCommands
entry.content:
Changes ApplicationCommands to not conform to ApplicationSettingsCommands. This will make dependencies clearer and

more granular.



Classes that implicitly needed to conform to ApplicationSettingsCommands

now do so explicitly. Classes that need to call settings commands now

have a dedicated handler passed in.



A follow-up CL will rename ApplicationSettingsCommands to SettingsCommands and move it into its own header.



Low-Coverage-Reason: LARGE_SCALE_REFACTOR This is a large refactor that touches several files with zero or very low test coverage that are themselves challenging to write good tests for.

entry.title: PartitionAlloc: Prefer C++ header.
entry.content:
C headers such as stddef.h are essentially interchangeable with their

C++ counterparts (cstddef).



We should be consistent. It has also the side effect of removing

duplicated #include when both are used. For instance in raw_ptr.h

header.



Script:

```

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "^base/allocator/partition_allocator" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

-e "\.py" \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}



replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

replace "" ""

```

entry.title: Revert "Fix software rendering of Fluent overlay animation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 922af472cbdd0faa8c13ebf7f55dcfc73f2c81e8.



Reason for revert: [Chromium Gardener] Multiple failures of LayerTreeHostScrollTestCaseWithChild* in https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win-asan?limit=200 since the CL landed.



Original change's description:

> Fix software rendering of Fluent overlay animation

>

> When hardware acceleration is disabled, the track's quad in Fluent

> Overlay scrollbar has the opacity of the layer instead of the value

> we set the for the quad's `vertex_opacity`.

> This causes a jank when mousing over the scrollbar since the track's

> opacity animation is skipped and it just appears at full opacity.

> This can be fixed by creating a new `SharedQuadState` for the track

> and setting the transitionary opacity in the state instead of the

> quad.

> Please find a more detailed explanation in #c1 in the linked bug.

> This CL also moves around some definitions of variables to be closer

> to where they are actually used.

>

> Bug: 1496407

entry.title: [ios] Correctly dismiss the "Repost Form" dialog
entry.content:
The BrowserCoordinator did not correctly dismiss the "Report Form"

dialog when dismissing all modals (but still remove the view). Due

to that, if a new tab was opened (via an external application or a

long press on the app icon), the modal was removed but the helper

considered it still presented.



Fix BrowserCoordinator to call -stopRepostFormCoordinator when the

modals are dismissed. Additionally, change RepostFormTabHelper to

dismiss the dialog if the WebState is hidden (this should not be

necessary right now, but will prevent similar problem to appear).



Fixed: 1490764

entry.title: Fix the permanent back trapping using same document entries
entry.content:
This fix enhances the history manipulation intervention such that

same document entries cannot be used to achieve permanent back trapping.

The original intervention stops working when there is a user activation

which does not get cleared after the user goes back and forth between

same document entries. So creating new same document entries becomes a

way to hijack the back button. This enhancement fixes the following

scenario:

1. History contains [new-tab-page, a*]

2. A gets a click and adds a same-document entry a1 =>

[new-tab-page, a, a1*]

3. User goes back to a via the back button

[new-tab-page, a*, a1]

4. Without any new user activation, a adds another new same document

entry a2. Page a should now be marked as skippable.

[new-tab-page, a(skip), a2*]

5. Now when the user goes back, they should land on new-tab-page.



Bug: 1248529

Change-Id: I6de52ab75aef151abd65d4a02de56bd7f791eb19

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3182862

Commit-Queue: Shivani Sharma

entry.title: Revert "Lazily create the TextureLayer for WebGPU"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 914cc2432e9c6a2ffc40fad894dcd6b6fe3ba93b.



Reason for revert: Several WebGPU demo pages don't render on 122.0.6254.0 (screen remains black). Repro'd on ToT and confirmed that the demo pages render with revert of this CL.



Demo pages that exhibit the problem:



https://webgpu.github.io/webgpu-samples/samples/texturedCube

https://webgpu.github.io/webgpu-samples/samples/cameras

https://webgpu.github.io/webgpu-samples/samples/cubemap

https://webgpu.github.io/webgpu-samples/samples/gameOfLife



Original change's description:

> Lazily create the TextureLayer for WebGPU

>

> If the TextureLayer of canvas already created, its background color

> will be drawn to the layer. But if TextureLayer has no texture, this

> layer can not be composited. This CL delays creating TextureLayer for

> WebGPU until GetNewTexture, ensuring TextureLayer can be composited.

>

> Bug: 1516905

> Change-Id: I957d0e2d5a026933cd36e82dea96d83ae9d034a6
